level.heading: Priority of certain liens arising by operation of law.
level.text: When a person in the ordinary course of his business furnishes services or materials with respect to goods subject to a security interest, a lien upon goods in the possession of such person given by statute or rule of law for such materials or services takes priority over a perfected security interest unless the lien is statutory and the statute expressly provides otherwise.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For Law 13-201, see notes following ยง 28:9-101.
